fields.summary: Ceph null context assertion crashed eucalyptus-cloud

comments.body:
Unfortunately I found no coredump. I may have to do "ulimit -c unlimited" to allow it (currently 0).

This looks very similar to other issues: EUCA-12953 logged by [~vasya] 4 months ago, and 4 support tickets SUP-685, SUP-651, SUP-617, and SUP-608.
I recommend putting service overrides in /etc/systemd/system/eucalyptus-cloud.service.d, FWIW.  That puts it firmly in admin-controlled territory and makes it less likely to be forgotten.

If this is indeed http://tracker.ceph.com/issues/14115 (which seems most likely), then there were fixes put into a branch in January that have not yet been merged. Need to watch this. In the bug, 12 days ago someone noted "Seems harder to hit in our test environment now, but I did see this in one recent run."

This issue, and the others listed in the above comment https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-13199?focusedCommentId=117116&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-117116 , were all seen in Hammer versions of Ceph, v0.94.x.

AFAIK, this issue has never appeared since we started testing with Jewel, v10.2.6.
[~lincoln.thomas], can this issue be closed as not reproducible in Jewel then?
I'm fine with the issue being closed.
